website_summaries.verdict: This hammer holster performs well and includes an added pocket for keeping your screwdriver handy, too.
pros: Made from canvas rather than leather
Two compartments allow you to also hold a narrow tool
Holds the hammer well, and keeps it out of your way
cons: The slip pocket is functional but a bit hard to use on this model

customer_reviews.title: Tape measure slit@@@@@
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this item! Great with hammer pencil, screwdriver however I really had a difficult time putting my tape measure back, it was time consuming slowed me down and very hard to do with work gloves on. The slit for the tape measure was just not broke in and very tight that was my only issue I'm sure if I wore it longer and dealt with it let it break in It would have been perfect. Cant really have it keep falling off though! At least it stayed put, when I finally did put it back!
customer_reviews.author: Tom and Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: Great to help reduce clutter on your belt. Have used for a couple weeks already, and it is showing no signs of wear. Hammer loop is triangular (as opposed to round), so it hooks my milwaukee drill clips perfectly. Pockets are very slender and tight, but are perfect for fitting one or two extra tools that are low profile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ripped to shreds in about 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This product seemed simple and ideal. It actually checked off on all of the things that I was looking for besides longevity. This thing fell apart rather quickly and I don't think I will be purchasing another one.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: A Very Good Hammer Holster, but Pockets are of Limited Utility
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-made, functional and comfortable hammer holster, but the accessory sleeve is of limited use since it has no bottom and a carpenter's pencil will slip through. The other full-width pocket above is too tight and high to be useful.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Riversong

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice hammer holster for the money. It was alittle smaller then the picture had me thinking it was but that's my fault. I think it will work well for my hammer on my chaps for driving wedges.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Williams

customer_reviews.title: well built
customer_reviews.text: perfect for hammer god construction, loop and pocket usful for pencils or markers
customer_reviews.author: liquidtec

customer_reviews.title: the pocket is useless. Other than that it does exactly what it ...
customer_reviews.text: So, let's address the biggest issue with this hammer cradle: the pocket is useless. Other than that it does exactly what it needs to. My previous cradle would flop back and forth against my leg, tirelessly. This cradle stays put. I couldn't ask for a better replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Holds a hammer
customer_reviews.text: It holds a hammer. It is of sturdy construction & good materials. Had it for a month and its holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Carpenter of 36 years and I don't recommend
customer_reviews.text: It's kind of hard to explain but where the belt goes the weight of the hammer make the hammer Holder twist. So the back of the belt loop for the hammer holder becomes up front. I don't recommend if you are a carpenter to get this Hammer holder maybe a homeowner that don't use one often
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: value
customer_reviews.text: it is a little flimsy and the belt loop is too big.
customer_reviews.author: SQUiD808

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on and off.
customer_reviews.text: The pouch worked great for me at work. Unfortunately a bit too big for the little hammer I have to carry around with me, but well worth what I spent on it.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe011689

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Durable and it fits well on my ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Durable and it fits well on my tool belt. The price was really affordable. I'd recommend picking one up!
customer_reviews.author: JVY

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Not a very well built item. The stitches came apart in a few months .. highly disappointed There dose not look like many stitches holding it together
customer_reviews.author: Vinny M

customer_reviews.title: Good materials, convenient
customer_reviews.text: Great for carrying your favorite tool and good materials you know won't break. Not much else to say, it works and has enough room for large belts to fit through.
customer_reviews.author: hb dillon w

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well taped to the forklift holding a 3 pound hamer
customer_reviews.author: TEXPAT101

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Works great, has small sleeve-pocket for pencil, marker, spare bit/extension.
customer_reviews.author: Deneen Keane

customer_reviews.title: Its worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Love it been using it for a month now and its more than a hammer compartment👍works great.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Stitching tore on 2 of them within 30 days. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Jaegers

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction, but not ideal for field work
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty solid for use in carpentry or construction, but is cumbersome to use in the field to hold a rock hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Burzynski

customer_reviews.title: I like it, the holder fits a 2" web belt ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it, the holder fits a 2" web belt well. The loop for the screw driver could be just a little bigger, so I could get the bottom of the handle into the loop and not just the blade.
customer_reviews.author: CV

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like it. Small pocket behind the hammer loop is pretty useless though.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. It carried a geopick all summer with ...
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. It carried a geopick all summer with little sign if wear.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Tomahawkie Holder delux.  thanks
customer_reviews.text: Good price good product like the design thanks. Product seems to be good quality and will perform well. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: erty

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but don't bother if your not a tradesman
customer_reviews.text: I'm a roofer. This product is adequate. Not as good as a leather holster but decent for the money
customer_reviews.author: Dennis N.

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Fits a little loose on my bet but otherwise great
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Lee

customer_reviews.title: great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 12yr old boys toolbelts. They needed a hammer hook and these are perfect for them. They work on the job site with dad and this was just enough equipment space for them
customer_reviews.author: Erin T.Top Contributor: Jigsaw Puzzles

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I got this when i use the hammer around the house. It is well made.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just got it and it's already falling apart not worth it neither is returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Pencil's fall out!
customer_reviews.text: The one reason I bought this product, have a pencil and a loop in one unit. Carpenter pencil's slide right through it. Doesn't achieve manufactured purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Dundon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect hammer holder if that all you want. Very durable, not bulky, and has held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Dickies Work Gear 2-Compartment Hammer Holder for Tool and Work Belts, Durable Canvas, Includes Tool Loop and Pocket, Fits up to 4.5-inch Belts, Tan/Grey (57017)
product_meta.description: Color:TanWe’ve all been guilty of accidently leaving tools on the ground after the long climb up the ladder has already been made. To help make sure you’re properly prepared for the job at hand, keep the Dickies Work Gear 57017 2-Compartment Hammer Holder by your side. Designed to keep your hammer within easy reach, it’s constructed of durable gray and tan canvas and features a rivet secured steel hammer loop. For added convenience, there’s a small webbed loop perfect for holding a small flashlight or a screwdriver, and a slip pocket for holding onto a few nails. It easily slides onto belts up to 4.5 inches wide, and makes the perfect addition to your utility/tool pouch collection for your favorite belt or rig. Designed with functionality in mind, every Dickies Tool Bag is crafted of heavy-duty materials and equipped with features to help you work smarter. Each bag, pouch, belt, or rig is built to last. With reinforced pockets and tool loops, durable webbed straps, and an assortment of pockets to store every tool in the garage, these tough bags are meant to hold up to the harshest of environments. Whether you're a painter, carpenter, builder or weekend warrior, there's a Dickies Tool Bag out there made to keep you at the top of your game.
feature_bullets: LIGHTWEIGHT - Lightweight hammer holder with durable canvas and steel construction
DURABLE - Durable steel hammer loop for easy access of any stored hammer
ADDITIONAL STORAGE - Also includes a tool loop ideal for a screwdriver / small flashlight and one slip pocket
FITS MOST BELTS - Belt loop easily slides onto any work belt up to 4.5-inches wide
GREAT ADDITION - Great for construction workers, handymen, and DIYers

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars150 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
